greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of phi(q) * chi(q) in powers of q where phi(), chi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
reference: N. J. Fine, Basic Hypergeometric Series and Applications, Amer. Math. Soc., 1988; top of p. 60.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
George E. Andrews, Integer partitions with even parts below odd parts and the mock theta functions, to appear in Annals of Combinatorics, 2017.
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of phi(q) + 2 * psi(q) in powers of q where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan 3rd order mock theta functions.
Expansion of q^(1/24) * eta(q^2)^7 / (eta(q) * eta(q^4))^3 in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (2304 t)) = 48^(1/2) (t/i)^(1/2) f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t).
G.f.: ( Sum_{k in Z} x^k^2 ) * ( Product_{k>0} (1 + x^(2*k-1)) ).
mathematica: nmax = 60; CoefficientList[Series[Product[(1 - x^(2*k)) * ( (1 + x^k) / (1 + x^(2*k)) )^3, {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Sep 08 2015 *)
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, x] QPochhammer[ -x, x^2], {x, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Oct 31 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, polcoeff( prod(k=1, (n+1)\2, 1 + x^(2*k-1), 1 + x*O(x^n)) * sum(k=1, sqrtint(n), 2 * x^k^2, 1), n))};
(PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2 + A)^7 / (eta(x + A) * eta(x^4 + A))^3, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Sep 04 2007
